components.description: A bicycle, sometimes called a push bike, used for transport or sport.
components.title: Bicycle

description: A bicycle, sometimes called a push bike, used for transport or sport.
title: Bicycle

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Transport And Map Symbols -> Signage and other symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A bicycle, sometimes called a push bike, used for transport or sport. Bicycle was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji http://emojipedia.org/bicycle/
emoji_net_data.name: bicycle

bn:00083471v: To ride a bicycle or other cycle.

bn:00083395v: To drive fast; to step on the accelerator.

bn:00010248n: A vehicle that has two wheels, one behind the other, a steering handle, and a saddle seat or seats and is usually propelled by the action of a rider's feet upon pedals.
A pedal-powered vehicle, such as a unicycle, bicycle, or tricycle; or, motorized vehicle that has either two or three wheels, such as a motorbike, motorcycle, motorized tricycle, or motortrike.
A bicycle, often called a bike or cycle, is a human-powered, pedal-driven, single-track vehicle, having two wheels attached to a frame, one behind the other.
A vehicle with two wheels in tandem, pedals connected to the rear wheel by a chain, handlebars for steering, and a saddlelike seat.
A wheeled vehicle that has two wheels and is moved by foot pedals

apple_vendor_description: The bicycle emoji on Apple devices is a crisp, clean illustration featuring a classic frame with smooth, rounded lines and a polished metallic sheen. Appleâ€™s design imbues it with a subtle 3D effect, making the wheels and handlebars appear tangible under realistic lighting. It evokes a sense of freedom, activity, and eco-friendly transportation, often used to discuss outdoor adventures, exercise, or sustainable living.
